errors.cause: Need to specify correct type specifier

solutions.code:
od -A x -t x1 file    # Hex bytes
od -A x -t x2 file    # Hex 2-byte words
od -c file            # Characters (with escapes)
od -t d1 file         # Decimal bytes
od -t o1 file         # Octal bytes (default)

od -A x  # Hex addresses
od -A d  # Decimal addresses
od -A o  # Octal addresses (default)
od -A n  # No addresses

errors.cause: Multi-byte display affected by system endianness

solutions.code: od -t x1 file  # Always shows bytes in file order
xxd file | head  # xxd shows bytes in order
od -t x1z file  # x1 = single bytes, z = ASCII

errors.message: Want to view portion of file

solutions.code:
od -j 100 file      # Skip first 100 bytes
od -j 0x100 file    # Skip first 256 bytes (hex)

od -N 64 file       # Only first 64 bytes
od -j 100 -N 32 file  # 32 bytes starting at offset 100

errors.message: Want to see ASCII alongside hex
errors.cause: ASCII not shown by default in hex mode

solutions.code: od -c file  # Shows chars, escapes unprintable

od -A x -t x1z -v file  # Hex bytes + ASCII
od -t x1z file
xxd file | head  # Better hex+ASCII format
od -v file  # -v shows all data, no suppression

# * means previous line repeats until next shown offset
# Normal for large runs of zeros or identical bytes

errors.message: Want to extract strings from binary
